isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9200, 9300, 9400 Models Built After January 1, 1995 - ELECTRICAL TROUBLESHOOTING LIGHT SYSTEMS - TROUBLESHOOTING - CAB DOME, READING, AND COURTESY LIGHTS

svcproc.title: CAB DOME, READING, AND COURTESY LIGHTS

table.title: Cab Dome, Reading, and Courtesy Lights

entry.para: Does the left reading light illuminate when switched ON?
Check filament of left reading light. Filament OK?
Remove fuse F1-D and check fuse for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
Replace fuse F1-D and measure voltage from 14AY to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 14H or 14Y from B2 battery stud, then repair.
At left reading light disconnect connector (312) and measure voltage from 63R to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 63P or 63R from fuse F1-D, then repair.
At connector (312) measure voltage from 63R to 63-GR.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 63R, 11-GAB, or 11-GB to ground stud at right dash panel, then repair.
Replace defective reading light and switch assembly.
Does the right reading light illuminate when switched ON?
Check filament of right reading light. Filament OK?
Remove fuse F1-D and check fuse for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
Replace fuse F1-D and measure voltage from 14AY to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 14H or 14Y from B2 battery stud, then repair.
At right reading light disconnect connector (311) and measure voltage from 63T to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 63P or 63T from fuse F1-D, then repair.
At connector (311) measure voltage from 63T to 63-GT.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 63T, 11-GAB, or 11-GB to ground stud at right dash panel, then repair.
Replace defective reading light and switch assembly.
Does the dome light switch (442) indicator illuminate when switch is turned ON?
Disconnect connector (428). Measure voltage at (428) circuit 62AP to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 62A, 62S, or 62AP from panel light switch (425), then repair.
Disconnect connector (442). Measure voltage at (442) circuit 63F to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 62AP or 63F, then repair.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 62-GF, 11-GAB, or 11-GB to ground stud at right dash panel, then repair.
Do any of the dome or courtesy lights function with the dome light switch set to ON?
Remove fuse F2-B and check fuse for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
Replace fuse F2-B and measure voltage from 14T to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 14AG or 14T from B2 battery stud, then repair.
Do any of the dome or courtesy lights function with the left vehicle door open, the right vehicle door closed, and the dome light set to automatic?
Remove connector (442) from dome light switch. With left vehicle door open, and right door closed, measure resistance from circuit 63B to gnd.
Remove left door switch, and measure resistance from connecting terminal to mounting threads.
Replace defective door switch, and reconnect connector (442). Go to step 26.
Locate open in circuit 63B, or 63C between dome light switch and left door switch, then repair.
Do any of the dome or courtesy lights function with the right vehicle door open, the left vehicle door closed, and the dome light set to automatic?
With connector (442) removed from dome light switch and with right vehicle door open, and left door closed, measure resistance from circuit 63B to gnd.
Remove right door switch, and measure resistance from connecting terminal to mounting threads.
Replace defective door switch, and reconnect connector (442). Go to step 30.
Locate open in circuit 63B, or 63C between dome light switch and right door switch, then repair.
With dome light switch removed and in the automatic or door switch position, measure resistance between terminals 1 and 2.
Replace dome light switch, and reconnect connector (442).
With dome light switch in the position, measure resistance between terminals 2 and 3.
Replace dome light switch, and reconnect connector (442).
With a door open, does the left dome light illuminate?
Check filament of left dome light. Filament OK?
At left dome light disconnect connector (116) and measure voltage from 63M to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 63M, 63, 63Z or 63 to fuse F2-B, then repair.
At connector (116) measure voltage from 63M to 63N.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 63N to dome light switch, then repair.
Replace defective left dome light assembly.
With a door open, does the right dome light illuminate?
Check filament of right dome light. Filament OK?
At right dome light disconnect connector (115) and measure voltage from 63S to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 63S, 63, 63Z or 63 to fuse F2-B, then repair.
At connector (115) measure voltage from 63S to 63Y.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 63Y or 63A to dome light switch, then repair.
Replace defective right dome light assembly.
With a door open, does the left courtesy light illuminate?
Check filament of left courtesy light. Filament OK?
At left courtesy light disconnect connector (100) and measure voltage from 63V to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 63V and 63 to fuse F2-B, then repair.
At connector (100) measure voltage from 63V to 63H.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 63H or 63A to dome light switch, then repair.
Replace defective left courtesy light assembly.
With a door open, does the right courtesy light illuminate?
Check filament of right courtesy light. Filament OK?
At right courtesy light disconnect connector (100) and measure voltage from 63V to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 63V, 63X, or 63 to fuse F2-B, then repair.
At connector (100) measure voltage from 63V to 63H.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 63H, 63Y or 63A to dome light switch, then repair.
Replace defective right courtesy light assembly.
Cab dome, reading, and courtesy lights check good.
